sentences.en: Bark brown, flake off Schnabelia branchlet, sprig flower clustered on the top.
sentences.cn: 树皮褐色, 片状剥落小枝四棱,花簇生于小枝顶端.

sentences.en: Garnish each with a reserved sprig of dill. Serve with lemon wedges.
sentences.cn: 此后用保留的刁草叶做装饰, 上桌时伴用柠檬角块.

sentences.en: He wore a sprig of lilac in his button hole.
sentences.cn: 他在钮孔上面插了一小枝丁香.

sentences.en: I decorated the fruit salad with a sprig of mint.
sentences.cn: 我用小薄荷枝装点水果色拉。

sentences.en: On national days of mourning, for example, Australians are invited to wear a sprig of wattle.
sentences.cn: 比如, 在全国哀悼日, 澳大利亚人就会佩戴金合欢树枝.

sentences.en: Serve with ice cream. Garnish with a sprig of mint and a sprinkle cocoa powder.
sentences.cn: 可以和冰淇淋一起食用. 也可以用薄荷叶和可可粉装饰.

sentences.en: Sprig Spring and fall are good times to begin.
sentences.cn: 春天和秋天是种植的好时期.

sentences.en: The bark off a bit lumpy, sprig seems to be four prism.
sentences.cn: 树皮有点块状脱落, 小枝似乎是四棱形.

sentences.en: This nineteenth - century painting shows a Druidess holding both the sickle and a sprig of mistletoe.
sentences.cn: 这幅十九世纪的绘画描绘了一位女祭司手拿着镰刀和一些槲寄生的枝叶.

sentences.en: You need to put a wedge of lemon and a sprig of parsley on each plate.
sentences.cn: 把一片柠檬和一小根荷兰芹放在盘子上.

words.tran_cn: 在…上印枝状花纹（sprig的过去式和过去分词）
用钉子钉上；用小树枝装饰；使蔓生

trans.tran_cn: 小树枝，幼枝，扁头钉，<谑>子孙，小伙子，少年
trans.tran_en: a small stem or part of a branch with leaves or flowers on it
